**[Recall Knowledge - Spirit](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)** ([Occultism](/Skills.aspx?ID=11)): DC 35 **[Recall Knowledge - Undead](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)** ([Religion](/Skills.aspx?ID=13)): DC 35 **[Unspecific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 33 **[Specific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 30 [Saggorak Poltergeist](/Monsters.aspx?ID=1571) **Source** [Pathfinder #148: Fires of the Haunted City](/Sources.aspx?ID=13) pg. 45 **Perception** +20; [darkvision](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=12) **Languages** [Dwarven](/Languages.aspx?ID=3), [Necril](/Languages.aspx?ID=20) **Skills** [Acrobatics](/Skills.aspx?ID=1) +25, [Intimidation](/Skills.aspx?ID=7) +24, [Stealth](/Skills.aspx?ID=15) +25 **Str** -5 **Dex** +7 **Con** +2 **Int** -1 **Wis** +4 **Cha** +5 **Site Bound** The Saggorak poltergeists cannot travel more than 120 feet from area F2. --- **AC** 33 **Fort** +18 **Ref** +25 **Will** +22 **HP** 180 (rejuvenation) **Immunities** [death](/Traits.aspx?ID=40) effects, [disease](/Traits.aspx?ID=46), [paralyzed](/Conditions.aspx?ID=28), [poison](/Traits.aspx?ID=126), precision, [unconscious](/Conditions.aspx?ID=38) **Resistances** all damage 10 (except [force](/Traits.aspx?ID=75), [_ghost touch_](/Equipment.aspx?ID=297), or [positive](/Traits.aspx?ID=128); double resistance vs. non-[magical](/Traits.aspx?ID=103)) **Natural Invisibility** A poltergeist is naturally [invisible](/Conditions.aspx?ID=26). It becomes visible only when it uses Frighten.
**Rejuvenation** ([necromancy](/Traits.aspx?ID=117), [occult](/Traits.aspx?ID=120)) When a poltergeist is destroyed, it re-forms, fully healed, where it was destroyed after 2d4 days. These Saggorak poltergeists no longer rejuvenate once [King Harral](/Monsters.aspx?ID=1570) no longer exists as an undead ruler of Saggorak.
**Telekinetic Defense** **Trigger** A creature approaches within 10 feet of the poltergeist. **Effect** The poltergeist makes a telekinetic object Strike against the triggering creature. --- **Speed** fly 30 feet **Ranged** telekinetic object +27 ([Evocation](/Traits.aspx?ID=65), [Magical](/Traits.aspx?ID=103), [Occult](/Traits.aspx?ID=120), [range increment 60 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=248)), **Damage** 4d12 bludgeoning, piercing, or slashing (depending on object) **Occult Innate Spells** DC 33, attack +27 - **Cantrips (6th)** [Mage Hand](/Spells.aspx?ID=177) - **6th** [Telekinetic Haul](/Spells.aspx?ID=332) (at will), [Telekinetic Maneuver](/Spells.aspx?ID=333) (at will) **Frighten** ([Concentrate](/Traits.aspx?ID=32), [Emotion](/Traits.aspx?ID=60), [Fear](/Traits.aspx?ID=68), [Incapacitation](/Traits.aspx?ID=93), [Mental](/Traits.aspx?ID=106)) **Requirement** The poltergeist must be [invisible](/Conditions.aspx?ID=26). **Effect** The poltergeist becomes visible, appearing as a skeletal, ghostlike humanoid. Each creature within 30 feet must attempt a DC 33 Will save, becoming [frightened 2](/Conditions.aspx?ID=19) on a failure. On a critical failure, it's also fleeing for as long as it's frightened. On a success, the creature is temporarily immune for 1 minute. At the start of its next turn, the poltergeist becomes invisible again. **Telekinetic Storm** ([Concentrate](/Traits.aspx?ID=32), [Evocation](/Traits.aspx?ID=65), [Occult](/Traits.aspx?ID=120)) The poltergeist telekinetically throws numerous small and jagged chunks of stone rubble, either spreading them out among multiple foes or directing them at one target.
  • When this effect is spread out among multiple foes, the poltergeist makes a telekinetic object Strike at a –2 penalty against each creature within 30 feet. These count as one attack for the poltergeist's multiple attack penalty, and the penalty doesn't increase until after all the attacks.
  • When this effect has only one target, the poltergeist makes a telekinetic object Strike against the target, and the damage increases to 6d12. It deals 2d12 damage on a failure, and no damage on a critical failure.
